November will be the tenth anniversary of MR!
Monster Rancher Metropolis: The Cafe: Archived Topics From Prior Years: Year 2007 Topics (Year of the Goldfish Bowl): November will be the tenth anniversary of MR!
By Lisa Shock on Friday, March 2, 2007 - 02:38 pm:

I was wondering if anyone would be interested in a tourney to commemorate the tenth anniversary of the first MR game?

I don't know details about times for the event, it is a ways off in the future, but I was thinking about setting up the guidelines for entry so people could start working on their monsters. Anyone interested?

By VenomousX on Saturday, March 3, 2007 - 12:39 pm:

By Lisa Shock on Saturday, March 3, 2007 - 12:58 pm:

Well, Infernus, If you think you're up to it, I will probably raise one. I am still thinking about my loss in legendcup's MR1 Master's, and think I could make a better monster.

For those who haven't played the first game, you really should try it!

In some ways, it's a lot easier (you can feed infinite items per week) but in others it presents unique challenges. It's definitely the least 'cute' game in the series, and has a more anime feel to it.

I also like the music the best of all the games in the series.

If enough people enter, I will establish classes, like at legendcup. If it's just a few, then it's a free-for-all, so be prepared to face maxxed monsters.

By Gizmo the Lemur on Sunday, March 4, 2007 - 10:01 am:

and has a more anime feel to it.

What are you talking about!? The first MR game is no where near an anime compared to the abortions that are MR4 and EVO. EVO was literally a 101 on how to make a really bad anime, and turn it into a hideous JRPG. MR4 was just...well, words fail me for 4.

By Lisa Shock on Sunday, March 4, 2007 - 04:03 pm:

I was refrring to the animations when the monsters work. They have sweatbeads on the sides of their faces, etc., like old style anime.

By Lisa Shock on Tuesday, March 6, 2007 - 06:35 pm:

So, some basic rules for those planning monsters:

Any type of monster is fine.

No gameshark use, except for codes to get cash.

You will be expected to submit saves via dex drive save, to my email address.

No emulator use, must be on a console.

By Gizmo the Lemur on Saturday, March 10, 2007 - 07:14 am:

No gameshark use, except for codes to get cash.

It's not that hard to make cash if you follow the trick I posted a while back; time consuming especially if your critter gets lost, but definitely not hard (If you're too lazy to go to thread, go to the misc. MR1 thread unless it was deleted).

By Gizmo the Lemur on Saturday, March 10, 2007 - 07:17 am:

Apparently it was deleted, so I'll just quickly sum it up: Take an Int. Monster, get it C class, and just raise Intelligence to 999, and go to the very first temple you see in the July Expedition (Get one with a long life span like Gali). Depending on your luck you can make $40,000+ from diamonds, gold bars, and whatever else is in that temple.

By Lisa Shock on Saturday, March 17, 2007 - 06:10 pm:

November would be the time, mailing a memory card is fine, I will return it. Dex's show up on Ebay occasionally, just make sure to get the Playstation version, not the N64 one. Also, if you do get one look around for better upgrade software for it. The floppies that come with it have some pretty bad software. Interact published two upgrades for it, but they closed their website. There's also a good homebrew version called Dexter, search around, you'll find it.

By Lisa Shock on Friday, March 30, 2007 - 04:42 pm:

I'd like to mention that I posted an official tourney announcement in the Coliseum, and started a thread about this event in the Locker Room.

By Swezlon Uno on Monday, April 2, 2007 - 08:43 am:

How do you mail a mem. card. because I don't have a dex drive either.

By Lisa Shock on Monday, April 2, 2007 - 04:17 pm:

You'd send it to me. The address is in the Office of the Mayor, in the Parental Consent form for those under age 13.

I strongly suggest that anyone sending in a card make sure to wrap it well in bubble wrap, and maybe put it in a small box, just so it doesn't get crushed.
